bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 153 (Thursday, September 21, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BURCHETT:H.R. 5627.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 18The single subject of this legislation is:To require a report relating to the Special PresidentialEnvoy for Climate[Page H4457]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text:
This bill requires the Department of State to submit a report to Congress relating to the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate. The State Department must provide in the report

  • budget information on expenditures of the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate during FY2021 and FY2022, 
  • the number and names of employees working in the Office of the U.S. Special Presidential Envoy for Climate, and 
  • information about carbon emissions associated with the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate's air travel and the Envoy's meetings with foreign leaders.

bill.title: To require a report relating to the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate.

item.title: To require a report relating to the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate.
To require a report relating to the Special Presidential Envoy for Climate.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
